measured_by: Area under the Kaplan-Meier survival curve (AUC) in the willingness-to-wait task
justification: “The area under the survival curve (AUC) represents the average number of seconds an individual was willing to wait… The AUC was our primary dependent measure in all studies.”
construct: Willingness to wait for delayed rewards

measured_by: Slope of the WTW trend (linear regression of local willingness-to-wait over time)
justification: “We estimated the linear trend in willingness-to-wait ("WTW trend") … This secondary measure served as a proxy for the learning rate, with a more negative WTW trend corresponding to a faster learning curve.”
construct: Learning rate of willingness to wait

measured_by: Response time to sell a token after it matured in the passive block
justification: “If learning occurred in the passive blocks, we will see that an implicit measure of learning — response times (RTs) — reveals the participants' expectations about reward timing.”

measured_by: Explicit progress-bar marking of giving-up time
justification: “Participants were asked to explicitly report what giving-up time they thought was ideal… The mark that participants made was then converted to a time in seconds.”
